alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 19 at 3:11AM MDT until May 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR-RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING FRIDAY FROM LATE MORNING UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR-RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to southwest winds with single digit humidity, near record hot temperatures, and an unstable airmass will generate widespread critical fire weather conditions mainly over northern and eastern areas today. Elevated to locally critical conditions will continue through tonight in a few areas where gusty winds coincide with poor humidity recoveries. Critical to locally extreme fire weather will develop Friday when winds will be the strongest. Winds are expected to taper off slowly after sunset Friday. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley and West Central Highlands Friday from late morning until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands
